channel.title: [pi] Dialogue/master and pure npc/ [pi]
channel.description: Hello! i Recently opened a 317 PI pvp server when you first log on ever in the server Ever i want a npc to talk to you and say that welcome stuff and when you click to continue it asks you if pure or master and it gives the stats how would i be able to do that

item.title: [pi] Dialogue/master and pure npc/ [pi]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

In client.java, within the initialize() method add something along the lines of:

in dialoguehandler.java you’re going to want to make a series of dialogues (to your liking) and the first id would be the one you put in client.java

case 45734://Dialogue ID sendNpcChat2("Hello, and welcome to <Server name>", "Lets get started by picking your class.", npcID, "Name of npc here"); c.nextChat = 45735; break; case 45735: sendOption2("Pure", "Master");//I forget what sendOption2 requires. c.dialogueId = 45735;//Use this for clicking buttons. break;

Above is an example of the code and it’s probably not right nor should it be copy-pasted exactly.

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] Dialogue/master and pure npc/ [pi]
item.dc:creator: @jummppy jummppy
item.description:
@jummppy wrote:

look for starter in you client class if it’s there, go to player Assistant and search for addstarter and under that method add the dialogue

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] Dialogue/master and pure npc/ [pi]
item.dc:creator: @chazion chazion
item.description:
@chazion wrote:

it may be a bit more complicated that you think.

in the init() method in the client class you need to have an if statement that checks whether or not this is the first time a player has logged in( not that hard)

then what the other guy said you would send a dialogue using the dialogue handler/manager thing.

look for the classes. it gets easier when you learn on your own.

Read full topic
